intro: Dillwynia acicularis, commonly known as the slender dillwynia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and often nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid and semi-arid regions. It produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, and its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves. Dillwynia acicularis is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
